name.en: Theory and Application of Information Economics Ⅱ
name.ch: 訊息經濟之理論與應用（二）

remark.ch: 本課程需有總體經濟學基礎

goal.en: “This course aims to provide a general overview of information economics which have developed during the so-called “information revolution” of the last thirty years. Beyond the classical problems of asymmetrical information, which are mainly about optimal contracts and incentives, this course will also cover topics include the important role of outguessing each other in a macroeconomic context, and information management within the individual. Formal models will be discussed, however the emphasis is on the breadth rather than the depth. At the end, students are expected to link up all models and form a coherent understanding of information economics.“

content.en:
“1 Introduction
2 The macroeconomics of information
3 Application: Central Bank transparency
4 The winner’s curse
5 Application: The underpricing of IPOs
6 Information and selection
7 Application: The insurance destruction effect
8 Midterm Test
9 Optimal contracts
10 Application: Price–quality discrimination
11 The revelation principle
12 Application: Auctions
13 Delegation and moral hazard
14 Application: Bank deposit insurance and risk taking
15 Application: Credence goods
16 Final Exam“
